summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York, dated July 12, 2020, discussing a conversation with counsel regarding case disclosures. It mentions a woman who was involved in sex acts with Jeffrey Epstein and another individual, and expresses concerns about her being approached by defense counsel and the potential revelation of her involvement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a participant in sex acts with an unnamed woman and another individual.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email, discussing case disclosures and concerns about a witness being approached by defense counsel.

connections.description: The document states the woman was involved in sex acts with Epstein and another individual.

events.title: Attorney Communication on Case Disclosures
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails about a conversation with counsel regarding 26A disclosures, listing people who knew about the case, including a woman involved with Epstein.

keyFacts: A woman involved in sex acts with Jeffrey Epstein and another individual was listed in case disclosures.
The woman has moved on with her life, lives in the suburbs, and is concerned about being approached by defense counsel.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney suggested it might be useful to inform the relevant judge on an emergency basis if her involvement is revealed.
The communication highlights ongoing legal concerns and witness protection issues in the Epstein case post-conviction.
